headline: A federal judge in Washington, D.C., temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deporting a wider group of people without a court hearing, a blow to one of the key parts of President Trump’s deportation campaign
Israel begins heavy airstrikes ahead of Gaza City onslaught, warns Hamas fighters abroad that attacks ‘will reach them, too’
Average number of sick days taken by public servants growing post-COVID, new data shows
Watch: Putin, Modi and other world leaders in China for summit
Large Russian Air Attack Hits Ukraine, Amid Stalled Bid for Peace Talks
Cal Fire captain fatally shot his girlfriend, then killed her son to cover it up, prosecutors say
Newsom, California lawmakers strike deal that would allow Uber, Lyft drivers to unionize
Rudy Giuliani to remain in hospital after he was badly injured in car crash
Islamic Republic close to collapse in Iran, civil war possible after US, Israeli decimation of nuclear capabilities: experts
A federal appeals court struck down the Trump administration’s signature tariffs, finding that the president had gone too far in using emergency powers to rewrite U.S. trade policy
